| April 1, 2010 label3 = Total U.S. Population data3 = 308,745,538 label4 =

| Wyoming 563,626 header7 = Logo data8 =
}} The 'twenty-third United States Census', known as 'Census 2010', is the most
recent national census of the United States. National Census Day was April 1,
2010 and is the reference date used in enumerating (counting) individuals. Directors of the 2010 Census made an emphasis on getting
an accurate count, an emphasis that included the hiring of 635,000 temporary
enumerators. The population of the
United States was counted as 308,745,538, a 9.7% increase from the
2000 Census.
categories: Decennial federal censuses of the United States
